summary: Minister for Information and Communications  Minendra Rijal  has said consensus on the substance of the constitution could be made within two hours if parties wish to do so. Inaugurating the 36th General Assembly of the Trekking Agencies' Association of Nepal (TAAN) here on Sunday, Minister Rijal said, "The most debated issue of the new constitution, delineation of provinces, has almost come to consensus. If the parties want to move ahead by shunning obstinacy, they could come to consensus within a couple of hours". He reiterated that there is no alternative but to promulgate a new constitution within the stated time so as to institutionalise all types of changes made so far in the country.
title: consensus-soon-if-parties-wish-so-minister-rijal
